Comments_List: A wide range of introductory fundamentals of corporate finance: financial statements, stock valuation, capital investment, corporate governance, arbitrage, risk analysis, etc.
Very various areas of finance; theories and models are well demonstrated with real-life examples.
Learning about various financial instruments and valuation methods, how to calculate present value

It is an accelerated course, and therefore, covers a lot of material in a short period of time. Despite the condensed timeframe, instructor does an amazing job at teaching the course with remarkable passion and engagement. Every component of the course is well-structured and organized. The exams are straight-forward and reasonable.

The course is well-structured, materials are comprehensive and organized. The content is too intense as a one-month summer course. Sometimes the stuffs covered in merely one lesson generally needs to be taught over a semester or more.
Material felt a bit rushed, but instructor did a superb job considering this was a five-week summer course

I would absolutely recommend this course to anyone interested in going into finance or learning about the subject. If you're looking for a fun and intellectually challenging econ elective, take this. You'll learn practical and applicable fundamentals of finance. The instructor cherishes student engagement in class, so be present, both physically and mentally, engage in discussions, ask questions, and try to have fun. I wish I had taken this course in the fall to get the full experience, but taking it in the summer allowed for a farily intimate classroom environment. Overall, great summer class.
Yes, but only for the students who already study some finance-related courses before.
Recommended for any student seeking to go into finance
